summary.p: 2 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 124; Qurʾānic Text: Q 34:12, Q 34:22-34:23; 5 lines per page; Dimensions: 273 x 190mm; Script style: kūfī D.III.
The fragments Marcel 84, Marcel 86, Marcel 87 and Marcel 102/1 (NLR) belong to the same manuscript.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
2 fol. 190×273 mm (1.44). Support: thin transparent parchment, rigid, light-colored, yellowish on the hair side. Writing material: brown ink.
Collation: one outer bifolium of a quire , with lacuna of 6 fol.
Text layout: 84×168 mm (2.0), 5 lines. Ruling: absent. Script: D III. Diacritics: bue and red double diagonal dashes (only on fol. 2r). Vocalization: red, green, yellow and blue round dots.
Verse markers: for individual verses – rosettes (type 3.1.2) drawn in gold and surrounded with orange dotes (fol. 2r).
Stitching: traces of brown substance (leather of the spine?) on the outer fold.

Inscriptions: numbers of surahs in Roman numerals and the verse numbers in Arabic numerals are inscribed in ink on the upper margins of all sheets; verse numbers are also written in the text; on fol. 1r and 2 r in the upper right corner the numbers of the last verse and the catchword of the previous (missing) page are written.
Defects: minor stains; the fold is torn up to the middle; margins damaged, probably by rodents and partly lost, their edges darkened; ink has partly peeled off on the flesh sides.
Fol. 1r–1v. Surah 34, verses11(12). Incipit: [ولسليمان] الريح عدوها. Explicit: نذقه [من عذاب] .
Fol. 2r–2v. Surah 34, verses 21(22)–22(23). Incipit: [السموات و] لا في الارض. Explicit: قالوا ماذ[ا قال ربكم] .
Other fragments of the same manuscript: Marcel 86, Marcel 87 (fol. 1 is the next one after Marcel 124, fol. 2), Marcel 102 (fol. 3, 5) (NLR)."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
